tweets.html:
Watching MTV. They Only Play Videos during Vampire Hours. I can tell you, Avril Lavigne hurts my ears and is like algebra to my penis.

— ted lyde (@tedlyde) April 6, 2011

How are vikings getting credit cards anyway? Do rape and pillage not affect your credit score?

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) April 6, 2011

Clearly, I do not understand "Extreme Couponing," given that to me, it looks ... you know, insane.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 6, 2011

Is the point of Extreme Couponing to generate more cast members for Hoarders?

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) April 7, 2011

Did James Franco book the Aflac duck yet?

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) April 6, 2011

These commercials for the revamped LOLA seem to assume the public has an irrational hatred of Skeet Ulrich and desire to see him suffer.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) April 6, 2011

Let go by AOL, & then get a press releasing touting a upcoming, super-sized, 90-minute #Glee. This just ain't my Wednesday.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 6, 2011

Gee, #Glee, are you sure 90 minutes is enough to say all you want to say about Lady Gaga?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 6, 2011

Things I do when I drink too much: order dvd's from the PBS website. #themorningafter

— Tess Rodham Rafferty (@TessRafferty) April 6, 2011

"Bravo... A Network For Shows About People Dan Would Probably Hate... And also 'Top Chef.'"

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

Hey, there's going to be a Bravo reality show about me! Oh, wait, no, there isn't. I was thinking of EVERYONE ELSE WHO IS ALIVE.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 6, 2011

Successfully completed a "Breaking In" story w/out calling it "Breaking Bad." Will celebrate w/leftover cake and meth!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

Good sitcoms are allowed one (1) central annoying character. Breaking In, unfortunately, has at least two.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 6, 2011

Don’t worry @charliesheen, I got booed in Detroit, too. Did you refer to them as ‘the ugliest city in Southern Canada'? They hate that.

— Sue Sylvester (@S_SylvesterGLEE) April 6, 2011

I've watched so much The Wire lately that I can't help myself to whisper-shouting "narcos" whenever I see a police car.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) April 6, 2011

The internet has achieved purpose. @TheOnion is digitizing its archives. Time to get an iPad and bid adieu to my friends and family.

— Megan Ganz (@meganganz) April 6, 2011

@GeorgeTakei is this year's Betty White.

— Adam Levy (@Roothlus) April 6, 2011

Wisdom from the writers' room: it is impossible to see Betty White and not say, "Hey! It's Betty White!"

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) April 6, 2011

Those vilifying @DamonLindelof's light-hearted Twitter feud with GRRM are clearly not following some other showrunners. #JustSayin

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) April 6, 2011

@Memles Uninformed outrage is the new black.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 6, 2011

BREAKING: People currently on TV shows will, at some point in the future, no longer be on those TV shows.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 6, 2011

OK, back to review deadline. TV STARS, NO ONE ELSE QUIT YOUR JOB TODAY.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 6, 2011

Would any big-time anchor who isn't leaving their job please raise their hand?

— Jonathan Wald (@jonathanwald) April 6, 2011

My right hand is raised RT @jonathanwald Would any big-time anchor who isn't leaving their job please raise their hand?

— Piers Morgan (@piersmorgan) April 6, 2011

Never mind "The Office." Will Ferrell in character as Ron Burgundy, my choice for new "Today Show" anchor. DO IT NBC.

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) April 6, 2011

Maybe if I get a really good night's sleep, I might wake up really invested in who's gonna replace who anywhere.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

CBO: GOP Medicare plan will cost seniors more money. Which is why GOP is announcing it quietly, while "Wheel of Fortune" is on.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) April 6, 2011

Reading trancript of Meredith V's intvw w/ Trump, I can safely say: Trump is the new @charliesheen: Egomaniac empowered by slobbering media

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) April 6, 2011

NBC flogging TODAY interview w NBC star / not-really-Prez-candidate Trump. Maybe Skeet Ulrich shd pretend to run too!

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 6, 2011

@TVMoJoe I hope CBS News interviews Boston Rob about Afghanistan and Obama's birth certificate. Equally valid.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

@poniewozik NBC News should also interview Jillian Michaels about radiation levels in Japan and a possible government shutdown.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

@TVMoJoe @hitfixdaniel Your lack of interest in Parvati's thoughts on Israel saddens me.

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) April 6, 2011

@MattMitovich You know darn well that if somebody interviewed Parvati about Israel, I'd build a whole podcast around it.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

@EricIGN I would call Parvati's current affairs program "Deep, Not Shallow." And every episode would include foxy boxing.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 6, 2011

If Donald Trump wants to run for president? Bully for him. But for now, he's a second-tier reality TV star.

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) April 6, 2011

MrMaxAdler and I are brainstorming "Oprah: The Musical" in between scenes. It's a mix between Evita and the Lion King.

— Chris Colfer (@chriscolfer) April 7, 2011

Writing about Star Trek: The Next Generation while listening to the First Contact score. Set phasers on "nerd."

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 7, 2011

When writing a Being Human spec: if a scene with Josh & a girl doesn't make you want to bury your head in a pillow, it's not awkward enough.

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) April 7, 2011

Someone, tell me: has Christian Slater come full circle enough to be hot again? Um, please?

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 7, 2011

If comedy writing rooms in LA were run like Twitter, there'd be a lot more funny women working and way more plots about vaginas and rape.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) April 7, 2011

Today would be an excellent day for @tbrick2 to do a dramatic reading of my timeline.

— Julie Plec (@julieplec) April 6, 2011

To be clear, I love the passion -- I just wish some of y'all would stop hurting each other. Love Not Shove.

— Julie Plec (@julieplec) April 6, 2011

I unfortunately drifted into the @julieplec feed and I regret it. These are the moments I hate sharing a fandom with 10 year old girls. #tvd

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 7, 2011

I wish I wasnt a fan bc then I wouldn't feel the 2nd hand embarrassment of women yell at each other in front of @julieplec. #tvd #shameonyou

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 7, 2011

I would watch a reality show about people pitching ideas for the next great reality show about a reality show.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 7, 2011

Seriously, reality TV: unless you get at least three levels deep, you ain't incepting me with shit.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 7, 2011

Kloppenburg up, Beck's show ending... what would make this a better day for liberals? Extra-long This American Life episode?

— Dave Weigel (@daveweigel) April 6, 2011

Glenn Beck leaving Fox. I look forward to his "Torpedo Of Bullsh*t/Sanity Is Not An Option" Tour

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) April 7, 2011

Dear @glennbeck: I drink your milkshake.

— Angelo Carusone (@GoAngelo) April 6, 2011

Who's to blame for the end of Glenn Beck's Fox News show? Could it be... GEORGE SOROS? (Cue thunder, lightning)

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) April 6, 2011

I hope Glenn Beck and Charlie Sheen do a tour together. Of, like, duty. Somewhere exotic. Without cameras.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) April 6, 2011

I hope the studio execs at Fox News explained to Glenn Beck why he was being fired by using elaborate chalkboard diagrams.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 6, 2011

I'm worried the Glenn Beck show will end with a reveal that Washington D.C. was the snowglobe-fantasy of an autistic child the entire time.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 6, 2011

Glenn Beck leaving Fox News. Now the only place to find crazy, dishonest commentary on TV is every other show on Fox News.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) April 6, 2011

Like President Obama ended all racism forever, Glenn Beck's exit from TV means that no one will ever be crazy on a chalkboard again.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 6, 2011

Glenn Beck leaving FOX is like The Borg taking a shit.

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) April 6, 2011

Beck quancelled! MT @brianstelter Ailes: "Half the headlines say he's cancelled. The other half say he quit. We're happy with both of them."

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 6, 2011

Shorter Glenn Beck just now: "I have to go now, my planet needs me."

— Daniel Foster (@DanFosterType) April 6, 2011

"All TV is, is really: ‘Don’t you want to be this? Aren’t you glad you’re not that?’ There’s nothing really in the middle." — Adam Carolla

— after the flood (@apresledeluge) April 7, 2011

@apresledeluge Does not cover QVC.

— Kevin Li (@kevinlig) April 7, 2011

I'm being followed by Survivor Canada. I thought just living in Canada was its own game of Survivor.

— Veronica (@MyPolishFace) April 7, 2011

Boston Rob: God among men.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) April 7, 2011

tweets.author_name: Derek Kompare will return in DIAMONDS ARE FOREVER
tweets.html:
But not among fans of Oreos, rom-coms, or Christ #murlonio! RT @corybarker: Boston Rob: God among men.

— Derek Kompare will return in DIAMONDS ARE FOREVER (@d_kompare) April 7, 2011

Anybody else wonder how Bravo has ordered/renewed 79 shows in the last week and I can't get S.3 of "Make Me a Supermodel"?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 7, 2011

I think i have a teensy girl crush on Gail Simmons from Top Chef. That, and, I need all her clothes/shoes.

— Kathleen (@KathleenND) April 7, 2011

Don't forget tonight's Justified, which is so great it will clean your kitchen, wash your dishes, make you pie, and give you a foot rub.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 7, 2011

My actress friends should be watching Margo Martindale on #Justified. My writer friends should be making sure roles like it exist in future.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 6, 2011

SPOILER: Tonight's episode of Justified has the most powerful moments featuring a character wearing a Scooby Doo shirt in the history of TV.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) April 7, 2011

Tonight's #Justified definitely lives up to episode-that-cures-cancer status, but let's remember previous eps did the dirty work for it.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) April 7, 2011

I told you this was the hillbilly #Dallas! Mags just pulled a JR move at the BBQ, I mean "WHOOP DI DOO!" #Justified

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 7, 2011

Wow, #Lost alumni are even more screwed up on #Justified than they were on the Island.

— Lauren Charles (@LaurenECharles) April 7, 2011

Everyone needs to quit hitting Raylan's face. I'm serious.

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 7, 2011

Cancer cured! #Justified

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) April 7, 2011

I just rewatched entire episode of #Justified to see that last few seconds when Margo Martindale's eyes go cold. May not sleep.

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) April 7, 2011

What is up with FX drama's and transportation being the big bad? We had an airport on #Terriers, roads on #Justified and now I am wondering

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) April 7, 2011

We never raise ourselves up by demeaning the work of others.

— Carlton Cuse (@CarltonCuse) April 7, 2011

Sometimes I genuinely like Ryan Seacrest. Then I up my meds. #Idol

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 7, 2011

Best idea I've ever had: all program descriptions in cable menu should be written in haiku.

— Sheila Seles (@shelila) April 7, 2011

American Idol theme? Rock 'n Roll. Coach? will.i.am. Me? Incredulous.

— Ross McKeen (@mightytoycannon) April 7, 2011

Will.I.Am is an Id.Eee.Ut #idol

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) April 7, 2011

Oh God. I've never felt so embarrassed for Christian Slater. And I've seen "Hard Rain." #idol

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 7, 2011

Left room to investigate the source of noise in the lounge. Trap. I've never seen American Idol and I can't look away.

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 7, 2011

White girls with no soul are singing Aretha Franklin and Janis Joplin. Someone is playing a cello in the rain. What is going on?

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 7, 2011

Why is Will.I.am coaching people on singing? HE DOESN'T SING.

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 7, 2011

Oh my God, Randy really does say "dawg." I thought that was an exaggeration. I need to walk away now.

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 7, 2011

And now the illicit love child of Kenneth the Page and Marie Osmond is singing Elvis.

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 7, 2011

We're six performances into tonight's "Idol." 18 judges' critiques. Their harshest insult: Good.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 7, 2011

It's good to see the judges on Idol brutally grading everyone on a scale from A+ to A+++.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 7, 2011

@HitFixDaniel i think there was also a "nice" in there. they are so brutal tonight!

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) April 7, 2011

What I'm learning from American Idol tonight: my idea of Rock n Roll songs is different than theirs.

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) April 7, 2011

(1/2) Been trying to come up with worst song choice Idol contestants could possibly make to try to impress America's tweener girl crowd...

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) April 7, 2011

(2/2) After much thought I think worst Idol song choice would be "Wreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald".

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) April 7, 2011

You know, during the seasons when Idol contestants kept trying to "reinvent," at least it wasn't just pageant karaoke. I hate this.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 7, 2011

I do not believe that Paul McDonald would shoot a man in Reno just to watch him die.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) April 7, 2011

I think Paul actually found a worse idea that @ShawnRyanTV's "Wreck Of The Edmund Fitzgerald."

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 7, 2011

@sepinwall BREAKING Paul McDonald shot a man in Reno. APB issued. EXCLUSIVE

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) April 7, 2011

Paul McDonald just told the other 8 contestants to sit down. His performance was on a different level. #Idol

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) April 7, 2011

Paul McDonald: Pioneer of The Happy White Boy Blues since 2011.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 7, 2011

Lauren Alaina's shorts are...unfortunate. #crotchbunch #Idol

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 7, 2011

My mother has started live-Facebooking American Idol. It brings me immense joy. In case you were wondering, "Pia is sooooo good."

— Gretchen Gavett (@GretchenMarg) April 7, 2011

The way Scotty McCreary holds his microphone makes me want to die a little. #Idol

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 7, 2011

I will have nightmares about that shot of Scotty's face for a long time. Why Idol, why?

— Denise Martin (@denisemartin) April 7, 2011

I'm obviously watching Idol late, but "Do you watch rap?" is obviously the best thing Jennifer Lopez has ever said in her life.

— Rich Juzwiak (@RichJuz) April 7, 2011

There needs to be some sort of crossover event in which Sheldon and Abed try to out-pop culture each other. #timeslotfrenemies

— Laura Prudom (@LauInLA) April 7, 2011

The most difficult thing about the character of the Doctor isn't the regeneration, its that he's on TV. I'd think he should hate television.

— Chris Kringleson (@cwilk) April 7, 2011

Saddest thing about the Real World drunken fight tonight? The bag of cheetos with the electrical tape covering the logo.

— Tess Rodham Rafferty (@TessRafferty) April 7, 2011

Is Curtis Stone really a good chef? Or just a handsome Aussie who will come to your house & flirt with your wife while cooking you dinner?

— Eric Almendral (@EricOnMedia) April 7, 2011

Catching up tv thoughts: they should rename #americasnextgreatrestaurant #americasnextgreatmealyoucaneatwhilewalking

— Louisa S (@l_e_s) April 7, 2011
